The original statement, "The movie must have been in English", asserts that the movie was presented in the English language. This statement does not provide any information about the presence or absence of subtitles.

The second statement, "The movie must have been in English or had English subtitles", presents two possibilities: either the movie was in English, or it had English subtitles (or both).

If the movie was indeed in English, as stated in the original statement, then the second statement would also be true because one of its conditions (the movie being in English) is satisfied.
